content: **major erratum ** in versions 1 and 2 left and right were mislabelled i apologize for any confusion i forgot to change from my scratch notes i took while knitting version 3 is up-to-date this sweater is designed to use up mini collections in a way that minimizes disruptions to striping and the cutting of precious little minis the resulting sweater has a relaxed fit similar to your favorite t-shirt with sleeves utilizing a slight drop sleeve and batwing shape for an armhole that doesn t restrict movement but a smooth taper to cropped sleeves that don t get in the way finished with a crew neckline to mirror the t-shirt feel while further minimizing the disruption of the mini striping this sweater is a great mix of comfortable wearability and showcasing that artistic mini set and as we all know from the iconic serenade the best time to wear a striped sweater is… all the time needles us size 2 ribbing and us size 4 main body of size needed to obtain gauge yarn see chart gauge 26 stitches and 34 row in 4 stockinette body 24 stitches and 34 row in 4 stockinette arms notions stitch markers tapestry needle waste yarn for provisional cast on optional skills needed knitting in the round knitting flat decreasing ssk and k2tog picking up stitches kitchener stitch tubular cast-on/bind off optional i am happy to accept any feedback on the design i can also be found on insta @meerkat_knits edit to add chart with yardage is based on actual body measurements for widest part of body second chart is finished object sizing i recommend ~4-6 inches of positive ease **updated ** jan 3 2023 v2 1 published fixes typos/formatting in sizing chart and finished object size chart includes note on which chart is which included note to sew up underarm cast-on less compression on charts/ images leaving v1 2 up as the file size is much smaller and some people might prefer that
